title: Drawing, 1761
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and brown and gray wash, white gouache on off-white laid paper
signed: Lower right in pen and brown ink: Clerisseau fe/1761
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Howard J. Sachs and Mr. Peter G. Sachs in memory of Miss Edith L. Sachs
description: A ruined colonnade curves from left foreground to lower right. At the center of the composition a sarcophagus decorated with a cow skull serves as a resting place for a group of travelers. At lower right, an additional group of figures has been added with light pen strokes.

exhibitions.title: Excavating Design: 18th-century Drawings and Prints from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1761.
1761. Pen and black ink, brush and brown and gray wash, white gouache on off-white laid paper. Gift of Mrs. Howard J. Sachs and Mr. Peter G. Sachs in memory of Miss Edith L. Sachs. 1978-168-42.
